intro: Xysmalobium ceciliae, commonly known as the Cecilia's fairy lantern, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of Peru. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and colorful flowers. The plant produces striking, lantern-shaped inflorescences that are typically bright red or orange, attracting pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
